longTitle.p: COMMISSION IMPLEMENTING REGULATION (EU) 2020/382of 2 March 2020approving non-minor amendments to the specification for a name entered in the register of protected designations of origin and protected geographical indications 'Bergamote(s) de Nancy' (PGI)

citation.p: Having regard to the Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union,

Having regard to Regulation (EU) No 1151/2012 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 21 November 2012 on quality schemes for agricultural products and foodstuffs
OJ L 343, 14.12.2012, p. 1., and in particular Article 52(2) thereof,

recital.p:
Pursuant to the first subparagraph of Article 53(1) of Regulation (EU) No 1151/2012, the Commission has examined France's application for these approval of amendments to the specification for the protected geographical indication 'Bergamote(s) de Nancy', registered under Commission Regulation (EC) No 1107/96
Commission Regulation (EC) No 1107/96 of 12 June 1996 on the registration of geographical indications and designations of origin under the procedure laid down in Article 17 of Council Regulation (EEC) No 2081/92 (OJ L 148, 21.6.1996, p. 1).. These amendments include changing the name 'Bergamote(s) de Nancy' to 'Bergamote de Nancy'/'Bergamotes de Nancy'.

Since the amendments in question are not minor within the meaning of Article 53(2) of Regulation (EU) No 1151/2012, the Commission published the amendment application in the Official Journal of the European Union
OJ C 361, 25.10.2019, p. 11. as required by Article 50(2)(a) of that Regulation.
As no statement of opposition under Article 51 of Regulation (EU) No 1151/2012 has been received by the Commission, the amendments to the specification should be approved,

content.p: The amendments to the specification published in the Official Journal of the European Union regarding the name 'Bergamote(s) de Nancy' (PGI) are hereby approved.
This Regulation shall enter into force on the twentieth day following that of its publication in the Official Journal of the European Union.
This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
